alert.note: Alert for Northern Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 1:09PM AKST until February 24 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Northern Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until noon AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow, blowing snow and freezing rain will continue this afternoon and tonight. Winds will increase late Thursday afternoon with near blizzard conditions expected to develop Thursday evening.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
